title: Discussing Environmental Issues
description: Practice talking about environmental problems and solutions.

sentences.text: I think climate change is one of the biggest problems we face today.
sentences.translation: 저는 기후 변화가 오늘날 우리가 직면한 가장 큰 문제 중 하나라고 생각해요.

sentences.text: The more we recycle, the less waste goes to landfill.
sentences.translation: 우리가 더 많이 재활용할수록 매립지로 가는 쓰레기가 줄어들어요.
sentences.tips: 'The more... the less' 구조를 자연스럽게 연결하세요.

sentences.text: Plastic pollution is much worse than people realize.
sentences.translation: 플라스틱 오염은 사람들이 생각하는 것보다 훨씬 심각해요.

sentences.text: Using public transport is far better for the environment than driving.
sentences.translation: 대중교통을 이용하는 것이 운전하는 것보다 환경에 훨씬 좋아요.

sentences.text: Solar energy is becoming more and more affordable.
sentences.translation: 태양 에너지가 점점 더 저렴해지고 있어요.

sentences.text: In my opinion, everyone should try to reduce their carbon footprint.
sentences.translation: 제 생각에는 모든 사람이 탄소 발자국을 줄이려고 노력해야 해요.

sentences.text: Reusable bags are not as convenient as plastic bags, but they're much better for the planet.
sentences.translation: 재사용 가방은 비닐봉지만큼 편리하지 않지만, 지구에 훨씬 좋아요.

sentences.text: The weather is getting more extreme year after year.
sentences.translation: 날씨가 해마다 더 극단적으로 변하고 있어요.

sentences.text: Have you ever thought about reducing your meat consumption?
sentences.translation: 육류 섭취를 줄이는 것에 대해 생각해 본 적 있어요?
sentences.tips: 'Have you ever'로 경험을 물어보세요. 의문문 억양으로 끝내세요.

sentences.text: I've been trying to use less plastic recently.
sentences.translation: 저는 최근에 플라스틱을 덜 사용하려고 노력하고 있어요.

sentences.text: If we don't act now, the situation will get worse and worse.
sentences.translation: 지금 행동하지 않으면 상황이 점점 더 나빠질 거예요.

sentences.text: Many endangered species will become extinct if we don't protect their habitats.
sentences.translation: 우리가 서식지를 보호하지 않으면 많은 멸종 위기종이 멸종할 거예요.

lines.text: I've decided to start bringing my own shopping bags to the store.
That's great! I've been doing that for about a year now.
Has it made a big difference?
Well, I used to use about ten plastic bags a week. Now I use none.
Wow, that adds up over time. What else do you do?
I try to buy products with less packaging. The more carefully I shop, the less waste I create.
I've noticed that some stores are starting to sell things without packaging.
Yes, those zero-waste stores are becoming more popular.
I guess small changes really can make a difference.
Definitely. And the more people who make these changes, the bigger the impact.

items: Did you pronounce environmental vocabulary correctly?
Did you use appropriate stress in comparison structures?
Did you use rising intonation for questions?
Did you speak at a natural pace?
Did you use 'the more... the more' structures smoothly?
Did you complete sentences without long pauses?
Did you practice the dialogue with natural flow?
Did you use comparative and superlative forms correctly?
Did you use double comparatives ('more and more') correctly?
Did you use 'the + comparative' correlative structures correctly?
Did you express opinions about environmental issues?
Did you use appropriate vocabulary for the topic?
Did you engage naturally in the dialogue?
